title: Pass -DOMPI_SKIP_MPICXX=1 when building C code
body_html:
Better read the bug report in comments but from what I understand you should alwas define this when building non-C++ code linked with MPI libs. Otherwise you get symbols error.

As stated in the bug report, you may want to also pass "-DMPICH_SKIP_MPICXX=1" but I'm using OpenMPI so I cannot confirm it helps.
body_text:
Better read the bug report in comments but from what I understand you should alwas define this when building non-C++ code linked with MPI libs. Otherwise you get symbols error.
As stated in the bug report, you may want to also pass "-DMPICH_SKIP_MPICXX=1" but I'm using OpenMPI so I cannot confirm it helps.
body:
Better read the bug report in comments but from what I understand you should alwas define this when building non-C++ code linked with MPI libs. Otherwise you get symbols error.

As stated in the bug report, you may want to also pass "-DMPICH_SKIP_MPICXX=1" but I'm using OpenMPI so I cannot confirm it helps.
